    Exploration using dataframes Exploration using stars objects
  • Reference

    Plots temporal empirical means computed from temporal_means function

    autoplot.temporalmeans.Rd

    A line plot of temporal means with observed data in the background.

    Usage

    # S3 method for temporalmeans
autoplot(
  object,
  ylab = "Value",
  xlab = "Time",
  legend_title = "",
  title = "Temporal Empirical Means",
  ...
)

    Arguments

    object

    The output of the function `temporal_means'.

    ylab

    The y label.

    xlab

    The x label.

    legend_title

    The title for the legend.

    title

    The graph title.

    ...

    Other arguments currently ignored.

    Examples

    # dataframe example
data(NOAA_df_1990)
library(dplyr)
Tmax <- filter(NOAA_df_1990,                      # subset the data
              proc == "Tmax" &                   # extract max temperature
                month %in% 5:9 &                 # May to July
                year == 1993)                    # year 1993
Tmax$t <- Tmax$julian - min(Tmax$julian) + 1      # create a new time variable starting at 1
temp_means <- temporal_means(Tmax,
              t_col = 'date',
              z_col = 'z',
              id_col = 'id')
autoplot(temp_means)


# stars example
library(stars)
library(dplyr)
library(units)
# Example
prec_file = system.file("nc/test_stageiv_xyt.nc", package = "stars")
prec <- read_ncdf(prec_file)
#> no 'var' specified, using Total_precipitation_surface_1_Hour_Accumulation
#> other available variables:
#>  lat, lon, time
#> Will return stars object with 236118 cells.
#> No projection information found in nc file. 
#>  Coordinate variable units found to be degrees, 
#>  assuming WGS84 Lat/Lon.
temp_means <- temporal_means(prec)
autoplot(temp_means)
